page.title: 04Parish Councillor, Stoulton
page.content: A leading Parish Councillor lives in the former vicarage which is now a private dwelling. The old vicarage, a Tudor building, had adjoining stables which provided horses for the London stage coach. The councillor also spoke about the Maltings which used to be a brewery and supplied beer to the Talbot, both of which have closed down. The Maltings was then converted into a Post Office but is now a private house. Most village events are organised by the Parish Council. The Church Fete is very popular. The Flower Show is the top Dahlia show locally. The Parish Council also deals with footpaths, planning and road repair applications. They fought successfully to get a 40mph speed limit through the village and to have a telephone box removed from a dangerous cross roads.
